QW-WCAG-T26.name: Failure of Success Criterion 4.1.2 due to using script to make div or span a user interface control in HTML without providing a role for the control
QW-WCAG-T26.description: This failure demonstrates how using generic HTML elements to create user interface controls can make the controls inaccessible to assistive technology.

metadata.description: The element is a forced user interface control without the proper role attribute

results.description: The element is a forced user interface control without the proper role attribute

elements.htmlCode: Div with click added by onclick

QW-WCAG-T8.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.1.1 and 1.2.1 due to using text alternatives that are not alternatives
QW-WCAG-T8.description: This describes a failure condition for all techniques involving text alternatives. If the text in the "text alternative" cannot be used in place of the non-text content without losing information or function then it fails because it is not, in fact, an alternative to the non-text content.

QW-WCAG-T28.name: Using `percent, em, names` for font sizes
QW-WCAG-T28.description: This technique checks that all font-size attribute uses percent, em or names

QW-WCAG-T29.name: Specifying alignment either to the left or right in CSS
QW-WCAG-T29.description: This technique describes how to align blocks of text either left or right by setting the CSS text-align property.

QW-WCAG-T31.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.4.3, 1.4.6 and 1.4.8 due to specifying foreground colors without specifying background colors or vice versa
QW-WCAG-T31.description: Users with vision loss or cognitive, language and learning challenges often prefer specific foreground and background color combinations. In some cases, individuals with low vision will find it much easier to see a Web page that has white text on a black background, and they may have set their user agent to present this contrast. Many user agents make it possible for users to choose a preference about the foreground or background colors they would like to see without overriding all author-specified styles. This makes it possible for users to view pages where colors have not been specified by the author in their preferred color combination.

QW-WCAG-T16.name: Using HTML according to spec
QW-WCAG-T16.description: This technique checks that the HTML or XHTML web page follows the specification

metadata.description: The HTML document doesn't have errors,

results.description: The HTML document doesn't have errors,

QW-WCAG-T22.name: Failure of Success Criterion 3.2.1 and 3.2.5 due to opening a new window as soon as a new page is loaded
QW-WCAG-T22.description: The objective of this technique is to ensure that pages do not disorient users by opening up one or more new windows that automatically attain focus as soon as a page is loaded.

results.description: Browser didn't open new tab

QW-ACT-R1.name: HTML Page has a title
QW-ACT-R1.description: This rule checks that the HTML page has a title.

metadata.description: The `title` element exists and it's not empty ("").

results.description: The `title` element exists and it's not empty ("").

elements.htmlCode: <title>Page Test</title>

QW-ACT-R43.name: Scrollable element is keyboard accessible
QW-ACT-R43.description: This rule checks that scrollable elements can be scrolled by keyboard

QW-ACT-R2.name: HTML has lang attribute
QW-ACT-R2.description: This rule checks that the html element has a non-empty lang or xml:lang attribute.

metadata.description: The `lang` attribute exists and has a value.

results.description: The `lang` attribute exists and has a value.

elements.htmlCode: <html lang="en"><head></head><body></body></html>

QW-ACT-R3.name: HTML lang and xml:lang match
QW-ACT-R3.description: The rule checks that for the html element, there is no mismatch between the primary language in non-empty lang and xml:lang attributes, if both are used.

QW-ACT-R5.name: Validity of HTML Lang attribute
QW-ACT-R5.description: This rule checks the lang or xml:lang attribute has a valid language subtag.

metadata.description: The `lang` attribute has a valid value.

results.description: The `lang` attribute has a valid value.

elements.htmlCode: <html lang="en"><head></head><body></body></html>

QW-ACT-R63.name: Document has a landmark with non-repeated content
QW-ACT-R63.description: This rule checks that each page has an element with a landmark semantic role starting with non-repeated content

metadata.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

results.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

elements.htmlCode: <html lang="en"><head></head><body></body></html>

results.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

elements.htmlCode: <html><head></head><body></body></html>

QW-ACT-R64.name: Document has heading for non-repeated content
QW-ACT-R64.description: This rule checks that the non-repeated content contains a heading

metadata.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

results.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

elements.htmlCode: <html lang="en"><head></head><body></body></html>

results.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

elements.htmlCode: <html><head></head><body></body></html>

QW-ACT-R73.name: Block of repeated content is collapsible
QW-ACT-R73.description: This rule checks that repeated blocks of content are collapsible.

metadata.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

results.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

elements.htmlCode: <html lang="en"><head></head><body></body></html>

results.description: The page doesn't have repeated content.

elements.htmlCode: <html><head></head><body></body></html>

QW-ACT-R74.name: Document has an instrument to move focus to non-repeated content
QW-ACT-R74.description: This rule checks that there is an instrument to move focus to non-repeated content in the page.

QW-ACT-R65.name: Element with presentational children has no focusable content
QW-ACT-R65.description: This rule checks that elements with a role that makes its children presentational do not contain focusable elements.

metadata.description: The doesn't element have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

results.description: The doesn't element have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

elements.htmlCode: <button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseOne" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseOne">Accordion Item #1</button>
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(1) > h2:nth-child(1) > button:nth-child(1)

results.description: The doesn't element have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

elements.htmlCode: <button class="accordion-button" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseTwo" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">Accordion Item #2</button>
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(2) > h2:nth-child(1) > button:nth-child(1)

results.description: The doesn't element have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

elements.htmlCode: <button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseThree" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseThree">Accordion Item #3</button>
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(3) > h2:nth-child(1) > button:nth-child(1)

QW-ACT-R76.name: Text has enhanced contrast
QW-ACT-R76.description: This rule checks that the highest possible contrast of every text character with its background meets the enhanced contrast requirement.

metadata.description: Element has contrast ratio lower than minimum.

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: Testing

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: This is a webpage used for testing purposes

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: Just use it at your own risk!

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nullam dictum leo at accumsan molestie.

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the, though the transition does limit overflow.

QW-ACT-R70.name: iframe with negative tabindex has no interactive elements
QW-ACT-R70.description: This rule checks that `iframe` elements with a negative `tabindex` attribute value contain no interactive elements.

QW-ACT-R15.name: audio or video has no audio that plays automatically
QW-ACT-R15.description: This rule checks that auto-play audio does not last for more than 3 seconds, or the audio has a control mechanism to stop or mute it.

QW-ACT-R23.name: video element visual content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R23.description: This rule checks that video elements with audio have an alternative for the video content as audio or as text.

QW-ACT-R26.name: video element auditory content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R26.description: This rule checks that video elements have an alternative for information conveyed through audio.

QW-ACT-R29.name: Audio element content has text alternative
QW-ACT-R29.description: This rule checks if audio only elements have a text alternative available.

QW-ACT-R31.name: Video element visual-only content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R31.description: This rule checks that video elements without audio have an alternative available.

QW-ACT-R32.name: video element visual content has strict accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R32.description: This rule checks that video elements with audio have audio description.

QW-ACT-R75.name: Bypass Blocks of Repeated Content
QW-ACT-R75.description: This rule checks that each page has a mechanism to bypass repeated blocks of content.

metadata.description: The rule passed because of the rule QW-ACT-R63

results.description: The rule passed because of the rule QW-ACT-R63

elements.htmlCode: <html lang="en"><head></head><body></body></html>

results.description: The rule passed because of the rule QW-ACT-R63

elements.htmlCode: <html><head></head><body></body></html>

QW-WCAG-T1.name: Providing text alternatives for the area elements of image maps
QW-WCAG-T1.description: This technique checks the text alternative of area elements of images maps

QW-WCAG-T3.name: Providing a description for groups of form controls using fieldset and legend elements
QW-WCAG-T3.description: This technique checks the correct use of the description element for form controls

QW-WCAG-T9.name: Organizing a page using headings
QW-WCAG-T9.description: The objective of this technique is to ensure that sections have headings that identify them and that the heading are used in the correct order

metadata.description: Please verify that headers are used to divide the page correctly

results.description: Please verify that headers are used to divide the page correctly

elements.htmlCode: <body></body>

results.description: Please verify that headers are used to divide the page correctly

elements.htmlCode: <body></body>

QW-WCAG-T23.name: Adding a link at the top of each page that goes directly to the main content area
QW-WCAG-T23.description: The objective of this technique is to provide a mechanism to bypass blocks of material that are repeated on multiple Web pages by skipping directly to the main content of the Web page.

metadata.description: The first focusable control on the Web page is not a link

results.description: The first focusable control on the Web page is not a link

elements.htmlCode: <iframe url="http://verybadads.com" name="debug" title="Very bad ads for you!"></iframe>

QW-WCAG-T5.name: Using alt attributes on images used as submit buttons
QW-WCAG-T5.description: This technique checks all input elements that are buttons use alt text

QW-WCAG-T11.name: Providing text alternatives on applet elements
QW-WCAG-T11.description: Provide a text alternative for an applet by using the alt attribute to label an applet and providing the text alternative in the body of the applet element. In this technique, both mechanisms are required due to the varying support of the alt attribute and applet body text by user agents.

QW-WCAG-T2.name: Using caption elements to associate data table captions with data tables
QW-WCAG-T2.description: This technique checks the caption element is correctly use on tables

QW-WCAG-T4.name: Using the summary attribute of the table element to give an overview of data tables
QW-WCAG-T4.description: This technique checks the correct use of the summary attribute for table elements

QW-WCAG-T12.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.3.1 due to using th elements, caption elements, or non-empty summary attributes in layout tables
QW-WCAG-T12.description: The objective of this technique is to describe a failure that occurs when a table used only for layout includes either th elements, a summary attribute, or a caption element. This is a failure because it uses structural (or semantic) markup only for presentation. The intent of the HTML and XHTML table elements is to present data.

QW-WCAG-T14.name: Using id and headers attributes to associate data cells with header cells in data tables
QW-WCAG-T14.description: This technique checks if data cells are associated with header cells in data tables

QW-WCAG-T18.name: Using table markup to present tabular information
QW-WCAG-T18.description: The objective of this technique is to present tabular information in a way that preserves relationships within the information even when users cannot see the table or the presentation format is changed. Using the table element with the child elements tr, th, and td makes these relationships perceivable.

QW-WCAG-T10.name: Combining adjacent image and text links for the same resource
QW-WCAG-T10.description: The objective of this technique is to provide both text and iconic representations of links without making the web page more confusing or difficult for keyboard users or assistive technology users. Since different users finding text and icons more usable, providing both can improve the accessibility of the link.

QW-WCAG-T20.name: Supplementing link text with the title attribute
QW-WCAG-T20.description: Supplementing link text with the title attribute

QW-WCAG-T21.name: Failure of Success Criteria 2.4.4, 2.4.9 and 4.1.2 due to not providing an accessible name for an image which is the only content in a link
QW-WCAG-T21.description: This technique checks the text alternative of images which are the only content of a link

QW-WCAG-T6.name: Using both keyboard and other device-specific functions
QW-WCAG-T6.description: The objective of this technique is to verify the parity of keyboard-specific and mouse-specific events when code that has a scripting function associated with an event is used

metadata.description: The mouse event attribute doesn't have a keyboard equivalent.

results.description: The mouse event attribute doesn't have a keyboard equivalent.

elements.htmlCode: Div with click added by onclick

QW-WCAG-T7.name: Providing definitions for abbreviations by using the abbr element
QW-WCAG-T7.description: The objective of this technique is to provide expansions or definitions for abbreviations by using the abbr element

QW-WCAG-T15.name: Using the link element and navigation tools
QW-WCAG-T15.description: The objective of this technique is to describe how the link element can provide metadata about the position of an HTML page within a set of Web pages or can assist in locating content with a set of Web pages.

metadata.description: The element doesn't contain a rel attribute or doesn't pertains navigation

results.description: The element doesn't contain a rel attribute or doesn't pertains navigation

QW-WCAG-T13.name: Failure of Success Criterion 2.2.2 due to using the blink element
QW-WCAG-T13.description: The blink element, while not part of the official HTML or XHTML specification, is supported by many user agents. It causes any text inside the element to blink at a predetermined rate. This cannot be interrupted by the user, nor can it be disabled as a preference. The blinking continues as long as the page is displayed. Therefore, content that uses blink fails the Success Criterion because blinking can continue for more than three seconds.

results.description: Blink is not used

QW-WCAG-T17.name: Positioning labels to maximize predictability of relationships
QW-WCAG-T17.description: This technique checks the correct position of labels in forms

QW-WCAG-T32.name: Using ol, ul and dl for lists or groups of links
QW-WCAG-T32.description: The objective of this technique is to create lists of related items using list elements appropriate for their purposes

QW-WCAG-T19.name: Providing submit buttons
QW-WCAG-T19.description: The objective of this technique is to provide a mechanism that allows users to explicitly request changes of context. The intended use of a submit button is to generate an HTTP request that submits data entered in a form, so it is an appropriate control to use for causing a change of context.

metadata.description: Form tag doesn't contain any of the following elements input[type~="submit image"], button[type="submit"]

results.description: Form tag doesn't contain any of the following elements input[type~="submit image"], button[type="submit"]

elements.htmlCode: <form></form>

QW-WCAG-T24.name: Failure of Success Criteria 2.1.1, 2.4.7, and 3.2.1 due to using script to remove focus when focus is received
QW-WCAG-T24.description: Content that normally receives focus when the content is accessed by keyboard may have this focus removed by scripting.

results.description: Element kept focus

QW-WCAG-T30.name: Failure of Success Criterion 2.2.2 due to using text-decoration:blink without a mechanism to stop it in less than five seconds
QW-WCAG-T30.description: CSS defines the blink value for the text-decoration property. When used, it causes any text in elements with this property to blink at a predetermined rate. This cannot be interrupted by the user, nor can it be disabled as a user agent preference. The blinking continues as long as the page is displayed. Therefore, content that uses text-decoration:blink fails the Success Criterion because blinking can continue for more than three seconds.

QW-WCAG-T25.name: Using the scope attribute to associate header cells and data cells in data tables
QW-WCAG-T25.description: The objective of this technique is to associate header cells with data cells in complex tables using the scope attribute.

QW-WCAG-T26.name: Failure of Success Criterion 4.1.2 due to using script to make div or span a user interface control in HTML without providing a role for the control
QW-WCAG-T26.description: This failure demonstrates how using generic HTML elements to create user interface controls can make the controls inaccessible to assistive technology.

metadata.description: The element is a forced user interface control without the proper role attribute

results.description: The element is a forced user interface control without the proper role attribute

elements.htmlCode: Div with click added by onclick

QW-WCAG-T8.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.1.1 and 1.2.1 due to using text alternatives that are not alternatives
QW-WCAG-T8.description: This describes a failure condition for all techniques involving text alternatives. If the text in the "text alternative" cannot be used in place of the non-text content without losing information or function then it fails because it is not, in fact, an alternative to the non-text content.

QW-WCAG-T28.name: Using `percent, em, names` for font sizes
QW-WCAG-T28.description: This technique checks that all font-size attribute uses percent, em or names

QW-WCAG-T29.name: Specifying alignment either to the left or right in CSS
QW-WCAG-T29.description: This technique describes how to align blocks of text either left or right by setting the CSS text-align property.

QW-WCAG-T31.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.4.3, 1.4.6 and 1.4.8 due to specifying foreground colors without specifying background colors or vice versa
QW-WCAG-T31.description: Users with vision loss or cognitive, language and learning challenges often prefer specific foreground and background color combinations. In some cases, individuals with low vision will find it much easier to see a Web page that has white text on a black background, and they may have set their user agent to present this contrast. Many user agents make it possible for users to choose a preference about the foreground or background colors they would like to see without overriding all author-specified styles. This makes it possible for users to view pages where colors have not been specified by the author in their preferred color combination.

QW-ACT-R44.name: Links with identical accessible names and context serve equivalent purpose
QW-ACT-R44.description: This rule checks that links with identical accessible names and context resolve to the same or equivalent resources.

QW-ACT-R41.name: Error message describes invalid form field value
QW-ACT-R41.description: This rule checks that text error messages provided when the user completes a form field with invalid values or using an invalid format, identify the cause of the error or how to fix the error.

QW-ACT-R20.name: role attribute has valid value
QW-ACT-R20.description: This rule checks that each role attribute has a valid value.

QW-ACT-R33.name: ARIA required context role
QW-ACT-R33.description: This rule checks that an element with an explicit semantic role exists inside its required context.

QW-ACT-R17.name: Image has accessible name
QW-ACT-R17.description: This rule checks that each image that is not marked as decorative, has an accessible name.

QW-ACT-R19.name: iframe element has accessible name
QW-ACT-R19.description: This rule checks that each iframe element has an accessible name.

metadata.description: The test target has an accessible name.

results.description: The test target has an accessible name.

elements.htmlCode: <iframe url="http://verybadads.com" name="debug" title="Very bad ads for you!"></iframe>

QW-ACT-R58.name: audio element content has transcript
QW-ACT-R58.description: Non-streaming audio elements must have a text alternative for all included auditory information.

QW-ACT-R59.name: audio element content is media alternative for text
QW-ACT-R59.description: This rule checks audio is a media alternative for text on the page.

QW-ACT-R30.name: Visible label is part of accessible name
QW-ACT-R30.description: This rule checks that interactive elements labeled through their content have their visible label as part of their accessible name.

QW-ACT-R51.name: video element visual-only content is media alternative for text
QW-ACT-R51.description: This rule checks non-streaming silent video is a media alternative for text on the page.

QW-ACT-R52.name: video element visual-only content has description track
QW-ACT-R52.description: This rule checks that description tracks that come with non-streaming video elements, without audio, are descriptive.

QW-ACT-R53.name: video element visual-only content has transcript
QW-ACT-R53.description: Non-streaming video elements without audio must have all visual information available in a transcript.

QW-ACT-R54.name: video element visual-only content has transcript
QW-ACT-R54.description: Non-streaming video elements without audio must have an audio alternative.

QW-ACT-R55.name: video element visual-only content has transcript
QW-ACT-R55.description: This rule checks that non-streaming video elements have all visual information also contained in the audio.

QW-ACT-R56.name: video element content is media alternative for text
QW-ACT-R56.description: This rule checks non-streaming video is a media alternative for text on the page.

QW-ACT-R57.name: video element visual content has description track
QW-ACT-R57.description: This rule checks that description tracks that come with non-streaming video elements are descriptive.

QW-ACT-R60.name: video element auditory content has captions
QW-ACT-R60.description: This rule checks that captions are available for audio information in non-streaming video elements.

QW-ACT-R61.name: video element visual content has transcript
QW-ACT-R61.description: This rule checks that non-streaming video elements have all audio and visual information available in a transcript.

QW-ACT-R49.name: Audio or video that plays automatically has no audio that lasts more than 3 seconds
QW-ACT-R49.description: audio or video that plays automatically does not output audio for more than 3 seconds.

QW-ACT-R50.name: audio or video that plays automatically has a control mechanism
QW-ACT-R50.description: audio or video that plays automatically must have a control mechanism.

QW-ACT-R24.name: autocomplete attribute has valid value
QW-ACT-R24.description: This rule checks that the HTML autocomplete attribute has a correct value.

QW-ACT-R35.name: Heading has accessible name
QW-ACT-R35.description: This rule applies to any HTML element with the semantic role of heading that is included in the accessibility tree.

metadata.description: The test target has a non-empty accessible name.

results.description: The test target has a non-empty accessible name.

elements.htmlCode: Testing

results.description: The test target has a non-empty accessible name.
The test target has a non-empty accessible name.
The test target has a non-empty accessible name.

QW-ACT-R36.name: Headers attribute specified on a cell refers to cells in the same table element
QW-ACT-R36.description: This rule checks that the headers attribute on a cell refer to other cells in the same table element with a semantic role of columnheader or rowheader.

QW-ACT-R39.name: All table header cells have assigned data cells
QW-ACT-R39.description: This rule checks that each table header has assigned data cells in a table element.

QW-ACT-R42.name: Object element has non-empty accessible name
QW-ACT-R42.description: This rule checks that each `object` element has a non-empty accessible name.

QW-ACT-R67.name: Letter spacing in style attributes is not !important
QW-ACT-R67.description: This rule checks that the style attribute is not used to prevent adjusting letter-spacing by using !important, except if it's at least 0.12 times the font size.

QW-ACT-R68.name: Line height in style attributes is not !important
QW-ACT-R68.description: This rule checks that the style attribute is not used to prevent adjusting line-height by using !important, except if it's at least 1.5 times the font size.

QW-ACT-R69.name: Word spacing in style attributes is not !important
QW-ACT-R69.description: This rule checks that the style attribute is not used to prevent adjusting word-spacing by using !important, except if it's at least 0.16 times the font size.

QW-ACT-R48.name: Element marked as decorative is not exposed
QW-ACT-R48.description: This rule checks that elements marked as decorative either are not included in the accessibility tree, or have a presentational role.

QW-ACT-R66.name: Menuitem has non-empty accessible name
QW-ACT-R66.description: This rule checks that each element with a menuitem role has a non-empty accessible name.

QW-ACT-R7.name: Orientation of the page is not restricted using CSS transform property
QW-ACT-R7.description: This rule checks that page content is not restricted to either landscape or portrait orientation using CSS transform property.

QW-ACT-R37.name: Text has minimum contrast
QW-ACT-R37.description: This rule checks that the highest possible contrast of every text character with its background meets the minimal contrast requirement.

metadata.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the, though the transition does limit overflow.
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(1)

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

QW-ACT-R65.name: Element with presentational children has no focusable content
QW-ACT-R65.description: This rule checks that elements with a role that makes its children presentational do not contain focusable elements.

metadata.description: The doesn't element have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

results.description: The doesn't element have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

elements.htmlCode: <button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseOne" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseOne">Accordion Item #1</button>
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(1) > h2:nth-child(1) > button:nth-child(1)

results.description: The doesn't element have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

elements.htmlCode: <button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseTwo" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">Accordion Item #2</button>
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(2) > h2:nth-child(1) > button:nth-child(1)

results.description: The doesn't element have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

elements.htmlCode: <button class="accordion-button" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#collapseThree" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseThree">Accordion Item #3</button>
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(3) > h2:nth-child(1) > button:nth-child(1)

QW-ACT-R76.name: Text has enhanced contrast
QW-ACT-R76.description: This rule checks that the highest possible contrast of every text character with its background meets the enhanced contrast requirement.

metadata.description: Element has contrast ratio lower than minimum.

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the, though the transition does limit overflow.
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(1)

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: This is the third item's accordion body.
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(1) > strong:nth-child(1)

results.description: Element has contrast ratio lower than minimum.

elements.htmlCode: .accordion-body
elements.pointer: html > body:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(7) > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(1) > code:nth-child(2)

results.description: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.

QW-ACT-R70.name: iframe with negative tabindex has no interactive elements
QW-ACT-R70.description: This rule checks that `iframe` elements with a negative `tabindex` attribute value contain no interactive elements.

QW-ACT-R15.name: audio or video has no audio that plays automatically
QW-ACT-R15.description: This rule checks that auto-play audio does not last for more than 3 seconds, or the audio has a control mechanism to stop or mute it.

QW-ACT-R23.name: video element visual content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R23.description: This rule checks that video elements with audio have an alternative for the video content as audio or as text.

QW-ACT-R26.name: video element auditory content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R26.description: This rule checks that video elements have an alternative for information conveyed through audio.

QW-ACT-R29.name: Audio element content has text alternative
QW-ACT-R29.description: This rule checks if audio only elements have a text alternative available.

QW-ACT-R31.name: Video element visual-only content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R31.description: This rule checks that video elements without audio have an alternative available.

QW-ACT-R32.name: video element visual content has strict accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R32.description: This rule checks that video elements with audio have audio description.

QW-ACT-R75.name: Bypass Blocks of Repeated Content
QW-ACT-R75.description: This rule checks that each page has a mechanism to bypass repeated blocks of content.

metadata.description: The rule passed because of the rule QW-ACT-R63

results.description: The rule passed because of the rule QW-ACT-R63

elements.htmlCode: <html lang="en"><head></head><body></body></html>

results.description: The rule passed because of the rule QW-ACT-R63

elements.htmlCode: <html><head></head><body></body></html>

QW-WCAG-T1.name: Providing text alternatives for the area elements of image maps
QW-WCAG-T1.description: This technique checks the text alternative of area elements of images maps

QW-WCAG-T3.name: Providing a description for groups of form controls using fieldset and legend elements
QW-WCAG-T3.description: This technique checks the correct use of the description element for form controls

QW-WCAG-T9.name: Organizing a page using headings
QW-WCAG-T9.description: The objective of this technique is to ensure that sections have headings that identify them and that the heading are used in the correct order

metadata.description: Please verify that headers are used to divide the page correctly

results.description: Please verify that headers are used to divide the page correctly

elements.htmlCode: <body></body>

results.description: Please verify that headers are used to divide the page correctly

elements.htmlCode: <body></body>

QW-WCAG-T23.name: Adding a link at the top of each page that goes directly to the main content area
QW-WCAG-T23.description: The objective of this technique is to provide a mechanism to bypass blocks of material that are repeated on multiple Web pages by skipping directly to the main content of the Web page.

metadata.description: The first focusable control on the Web page is not a link

results.description: The first focusable control on the Web page is not a link

elements.htmlCode: <iframe url="http://verybadads.com" name="debug" title="Very bad ads for you!"></iframe>

QW-WCAG-T5.name: Using alt attributes on images used as submit buttons
QW-WCAG-T5.description: This technique checks all input elements that are buttons use alt text

QW-WCAG-T11.name: Providing text alternatives on applet elements
QW-WCAG-T11.description: Provide a text alternative for an applet by using the alt attribute to label an applet and providing the text alternative in the body of the applet element. In this technique, both mechanisms are required due to the varying support of the alt attribute and applet body text by user agents.

QW-WCAG-T2.name: Using caption elements to associate data table captions with data tables
QW-WCAG-T2.description: This technique checks the caption element is correctly use on tables

QW-WCAG-T4.name: Using the summary attribute of the table element to give an overview of data tables
QW-WCAG-T4.description: This technique checks the correct use of the summary attribute for table elements

QW-WCAG-T12.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.3.1 due to using th elements, caption elements, or non-empty summary attributes in layout tables
QW-WCAG-T12.description: The objective of this technique is to describe a failure that occurs when a table used only for layout includes either th elements, a summary attribute, or a caption element. This is a failure because it uses structural (or semantic) markup only for presentation. The intent of the HTML and XHTML table elements is to present data.

QW-WCAG-T14.name: Using id and headers attributes to associate data cells with header cells in data tables
QW-WCAG-T14.description: This technique checks if data cells are associated with header cells in data tables

QW-WCAG-T18.name: Using table markup to present tabular information
QW-WCAG-T18.description: The objective of this technique is to present tabular information in a way that preserves relationships within the information even when users cannot see the table or the presentation format is changed. Using the table element with the child elements tr, th, and td makes these relationships perceivable.

QW-WCAG-T10.name: Combining adjacent image and text links for the same resource
QW-WCAG-T10.description: The objective of this technique is to provide both text and iconic representations of links without making the web page more confusing or difficult for keyboard users or assistive technology users. Since different users finding text and icons more usable, providing both can improve the accessibility of the link.

QW-WCAG-T20.name: Supplementing link text with the title attribute
QW-WCAG-T20.description: Supplementing link text with the title attribute

QW-WCAG-T21.name: Failure of Success Criteria 2.4.4, 2.4.9 and 4.1.2 due to not providing an accessible name for an image which is the only content in a link
QW-WCAG-T21.description: This technique checks the text alternative of images which are the only content of a link

QW-WCAG-T6.name: Using both keyboard and other device-specific functions
QW-WCAG-T6.description: The objective of this technique is to verify the parity of keyboard-specific and mouse-specific events when code that has a scripting function associated with an event is used

QW-WCAG-T7.name: Providing definitions for abbreviations by using the abbr element
QW-WCAG-T7.description: The objective of this technique is to provide expansions or definitions for abbreviations by using the abbr element

QW-WCAG-T15.name: Using the link element and navigation tools
QW-WCAG-T15.description: The objective of this technique is to describe how the link element can provide metadata about the position of an HTML page within a set of Web pages or can assist in locating content with a set of Web pages.

metadata.description: The element doesn't contain a rel attribute or doesn't pertains navigation

results.description: The element doesn't contain a rel attribute or doesn't pertains navigation

elements.htmlCode: <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.0.0-beta3/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet" integrity="sha384-eOJMYsd53ii+scO/bJGFsiCZc+5NDVN2yr8+0RDqr0Ql0h+rP48ckxlpbzKgwra6" crossorigin="anonymous">

QW-WCAG-T13.name: Failure of Success Criterion 2.2.2 due to using the blink element
QW-WCAG-T13.description: The blink element, while not part of the official HTML or XHTML specification, is supported by many user agents. It causes any text inside the element to blink at a predetermined rate. This cannot be interrupted by the user, nor can it be disabled as a preference. The blinking continues as long as the page is displayed. Therefore, content that uses blink fails the Success Criterion because blinking can continue for more than three seconds.

results.description: Blink is not used

QW-WCAG-T17.name: Positioning labels to maximize predictability of relationships
QW-WCAG-T17.description: This technique checks the correct position of labels in forms

QW-WCAG-T32.name: Using ol, ul and dl for lists or groups of links
QW-WCAG-T32.description: The objective of this technique is to create lists of related items using list elements appropriate for their purposes

QW-WCAG-T19.name: Providing submit buttons
QW-WCAG-T19.description: The objective of this technique is to provide a mechanism that allows users to explicitly request changes of context. The intended use of a submit button is to generate an HTTP request that submits data entered in a form, so it is an appropriate control to use for causing a change of context.

metadata.description: Form tag doesn't contain any of the following elements input[type~="submit image"], button[type="submit"]

results.description: Form tag doesn't contain any of the following elements input[type~="submit image"], button[type="submit"]

elements.htmlCode: <form></form>

QW-WCAG-T24.name: Failure of Success Criteria 2.1.1, 2.4.7, and 3.2.1 due to using script to remove focus when focus is received
QW-WCAG-T24.description: Content that normally receives focus when the content is accessed by keyboard may have this focus removed by scripting.

QW-WCAG-T30.name: Failure of Success Criterion 2.2.2 due to using text-decoration:blink without a mechanism to stop it in less than five seconds
QW-WCAG-T30.description: CSS defines the blink value for the text-decoration property. When used, it causes any text in elements with this property to blink at a predetermined rate. This cannot be interrupted by the user, nor can it be disabled as a user agent preference. The blinking continues as long as the page is displayed. Therefore, content that uses text-decoration:blink fails the Success Criterion because blinking can continue for more than three seconds.

QW-WCAG-T25.name: Using the scope attribute to associate header cells and data cells in data tables
QW-WCAG-T25.description: The objective of this technique is to associate header cells with data cells in complex tables using the scope attribute.

QW-WCAG-T27.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.4.8 due to using text that is justified (aligned to both the left and the right margins)
QW-WCAG-T27.description: This failure describes situations where blocks of text that are justified (aligned to both the left and the right margins) occurs in HTML, using the "align" attribute.

QW-WCAG-T26.name: Failure of Success Criterion 4.1.2 due to using script to make div or span a user interface control in HTML without providing a role for the control
QW-WCAG-T26.description: This failure demonstrates how using generic HTML elements to create user interface controls can make the controls inaccessible to assistive technology.

QW-WCAG-T8.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.1.1 and 1.2.1 due to using text alternatives that are not alternatives
QW-WCAG-T8.description: This describes a failure condition for all techniques involving text alternatives. If the text in the "text alternative" cannot be used in place of the non-text content without losing information or function then it fails because it is not, in fact, an alternative to the non-text content.

QW-WCAG-T28.name: Using `percent, em, names` for font sizes
QW-WCAG-T28.description: This technique checks that all font-size attribute uses percent, em or names

QW-WCAG-T29.name: Specifying alignment either to the left or right in CSS
QW-WCAG-T29.description: This technique describes how to align blocks of text either left or right by setting the CSS text-align property.

QW-WCAG-T31.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.4.3, 1.4.6 and 1.4.8 due to specifying foreground colors without specifying background colors or vice versa
QW-WCAG-T31.description: Users with vision loss or cognitive, language and learning challenges often prefer specific foreground and background color combinations. In some cases, individuals with low vision will find it much easier to see a Web page that has white text on a black background, and they may have set their user agent to present this contrast. Many user agents make it possible for users to choose a preference about the foreground or background colors they would like to see without overriding all author-specified styles. This makes it possible for users to view pages where colors have not been specified by the author in their preferred color combination.

QW-WCAG-T22.name: Failure of Success Criterion 3.2.1 and 3.2.5 due to opening a new window as soon as a new page is loaded
QW-WCAG-T22.description: The objective of this technique is to ensure that pages do not disorient users by opening up one or more new windows that automatically attain focus as soon as a page is loaded.
